Listen guys, 
 America will never fall. We are a super power, nuclear power, and a country with a dozen or so allies.
 Some people such as Liminus and others think that China is more powerful than us. Let me correct you.
 China would never attack us. I also beleive that no country is powerful than us. Not even China. 
 Yes, China has more man power in it's military. But guess what, we have more nuclear weapons, and a far better air fleet. 
 China is powerful in the sense that they have more soldiers on the ground. But, they have less weapons than we do.
 Second, according to my friend Daewoo, we would never go to war with China.
 He stated that China would never attack, and if they attacked Taiwan, we would more than likely not help them. The citizens of Taiwan know that they can not count on America. Now, get over it.
 Some of you are so fantacized over the fall of America. This will never happen. I think America will exist until the end of time. Reason is, unlike communism and monarchy, we are a democracy and our form of government works. 
 No country could ever attack America and win a war with us. China would lose big time. Reason being, is if they attacked us, we would nuke the #### out of Beijing. That country would be taken over and reformed. Now, this will never happen, so please shut the hell up everone.
 America will never lose a war with China I might add. So, quit worrying and get on with the matters at hand.
 -John

Rome was never supposed to fall. Neither was the British Empire. Neither was the Third Reich. Neither was the Soviet Union. What do all four of these have in common? That's right, they're dead and buried. Within a decade or two China will have weapons capability the equal of the US, and at some point in the next few years, US debt will come and bite it on the arse, we may well be in a global recession, but it is the US that will crash and burn. Emerging from the wreckage will be China and India.

 the chinese are already brining market in Europe, the ME, other parts of Asia, and large portions of africa online to replace the US as consumers, nto to mention the fact that they will soon be the worlds biggest consumer nation, not the US. 
 
 Truly the odds of China attacking the US are slim to none. They have no reason, no do they have a history of such actions. A far more likely scenario is the US attacking china...lashing out as dying empires tend to against those nations that would replace them at the top. It would truly be our last mistake.

Well, you do raise a good point, but the majority of their goods to come here to the U.S. so even if we don't get the rest of the world to boycott, I think that we could cripple theirs first, then worry about resetting ours. :) It probaby won't happen so their really is no reason to debate it now is their. lol

 
 Once agauin we are back to the weakness of our economy. We need those cheap goods to kjeep our economy rolling. Without them, we fail to exist. Additionall,y China has been buying US bonds ad currency in order to keep our economy afloat. If we cease buying those goods, they have no reason to hold those dollars or those bonds. They release those dollars and float the Yuan. Overnight the world has a new reserve currnecy (CW tells us that the only reason the Yuan is nto the worlds reserve currency right now isa that it is pinned to the declining dollar), the dollart falls off the planet, and Americans are starving in the street and dealing with hyperinflaiton.
 
 The only an dbest defense that the US has ever truly had is our industrial infrastructure. It was not our ability to overwhelm the enemy that won WWII, it was our ability to outproduce them. We have lost that ability.
 
 I do not think that a US/China confrontation is entirely out of the question. Failing empires have always made poor military choices in an attempt to prolong their lives. The problem with a war with China is that we dare not make nuclear strikes against their mainland, since the entire planet would quickly be oblitered when they retaliate. The problem is that a large portion of our forces become useless when you consider chinas nuclear arsenal. Going to war agai9nst a country like IRaq with no effective defense (though they have given a good run for our money) is one thing. Going to war against a country that has the ability to take out an entire carrier group with a single weapon is another.

 Actually you are right to a point The USA as a nation may exist in some form in the future but it will not be the USA you will recognize. 
 
 What is out there looming to distroy the USA
 1 the growing devide between the rich and the poor. With gap between the rich and the poor widening we may see a backlash from the progressives as the country saw 100 years ago. If not you may see the poor take this country in revolution as the bolsheviks did in Russia in 1917
 
 2 The current political situtation that pits party against party and american against american liberal vs conservative. No one will work together and we will rot inside leading to a fall much as the Roman empire rotted from within.
 
 3 The growth in corporate power and the loosening of regulations that safeguard the public. This is what led to the progressive movement of the late 1880s the industralists were to powerfull.
 
 4 The rise in power of the christian right. We may very well see the Exclusion of other religious voices as the USA moves to wards theocracy.
 
 5 The neo cons, who have control of the republican party and paint anyone who doesn't agree with them as anti american.
 
 6 Those who use national Tragedies, such as 911, to errode our civil liberties and turn us into one big police state.
 
 To say the the USA will not fall may be overly optimistic but one thing is for sure we will change.

I think the risk from the Christian Right is less the theocracy, but that they will stifle scientific development and education to the degree that the US loses its major asset, innovation. We're already seeing this with regard to stem cell research. This isn't to say that ethics should be disregarded in science, far from it, but if the US raises a generation of kids who think science is satanic then the possibilities for development are going to be slim.

As an interested spectator, one can't help commenting on the profound dismay expressed in this (and many another) thread about the direction in which the US appears to be heading at the present time. Cultural wars, economic uncertainty, domestic political discord, foreign policy fiascos, are all compounded in what I mean by "direction".
 
 Would any American care to outline a rescue plan for the USA? Does anyone, for instance, think that America should renounce its hegemony and retreat into some measure of isolationism?
daewoo

As an interested spectator, one can't help commenting on the profound dismay expressed in this (and many another) thread about the direction in which the US appears to be heading at the present time. Cultural wars, economic uncertainty, domestic political discord, foreign policy fiascos, are all compounded in what I mean by "direction".
 
 Would any American care to outline a rescue plan for the USA? Does anyone, for instance, think that America should renounce its hegemony and retreat into some measure of isolationism?

 
 Isolationism is not really an option at this point, nor would it be especially helpful.
 
 You have seen my solution. I think that the primary problem in the US is the complete and total lack of accountability in our government. Until that is addressed, everything else is a waste of time.
